node.statement: (Enhanced data and Besov space regularity â€” setup for k=2,3) By the construction of the Phi^4_3 measure (Hairer 2014, Gubinelli-Imkeller-Perkowski 2015), the measure mu is supported on enhanced distributions (phi, :phi^2:, :phi^3:) living in the product Besov space X := C^{-1/2-delta}(T^3) x C^{-1-delta}(T^3) x C^{-3/2-delta}(T^3) for any delta > 0. This enhanced data is essential: while :phi^k: cannot be recovered from phi alone (since phi is only a distribution), the Wick powers are bona fide random variables in the stated Besov spaces under mu. This is established in node 1.6.1 (VALIDATED). The key structural point is that the Phi^4_3 measure mu is defined on the ENHANCED data space X, not merely on distributions phi. All concentration inequalities for mu therefore apply to functionals of the full enhanced data (phi, :phi^2:, :phi^3:).
